meanings.definition: To run away in a panic.
meanings.sent1: The horses were stampeding after hearing a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The crowd started stampeding when they saw the fire.
meanings.sent3: The stampeding squirrels made the forest seem alive with energy.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was stampeding in her chest with excitement.
meanings.sent5: Stampeding through the field, the children laughed and played.

meanings.definition: A sudden mass movement of a group of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The stampeding of the elephants caused a commotion in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The stampeding of shoppers towards the sale created chaos in the store.
meanings.sent3: The stampeding of ducks across the pond was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The stampeding of thoughts in his mind made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The stampeding herd of buffalo kicked up dust as they charged across the plains.
